instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7050: What is D7050? Diodes between SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL and ground, these data lines allow the battery to communicate with the battery charging chip and the SMC..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots to unknown screen
threads.message:
I have this board that was liquid damaged. I marked these areas that had the liquid damage before cleaning and replacing components.

<DIODE>D7050</DIODE>/<CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR>/<CAPACITOR>C7060</CAPACITOR> area
vias above kbd connector and other side
<RESISTOR>R4856</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R4857</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R4858</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R4810</RESISTOR>/<CAPACITOR>C4810</CAPACITOR> ( These components were all replaced)
<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> area <CAPACITOR>C7150</CAPACITOR> (replaced <CAPACITOR>C7116</CAPACITOR>)
<CHIP>U1900</CHIP> and <CAPACITOR>C1924</CAPACITOR> (<CAPACITOR>C1924</CAPACITOR> was burned so I replaced it as well as <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>)

The machine turns on when I plug in the charger and it takes about 5 seconds before it boots to the apple logo.
It takes a few seconds and loads up to the page you can see in the pictures below. I see the trackpad cursor on the page but it won't move when I use the trackpad.
When I try to turn the machine off with the power button it doesn't turn work. I have to unplug the charger and battery in order to shut it off.

[url]https://www.dropbox.com/sh/vryoho2y7j04zsz/AABUniyEGPepOlIJWe4zjXJya?dl=0[/url]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots to unknown screen
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots to unknown screen
threads.message:
I disconnected the trackpad cable and turned it on and the same thing happened. I also plugged in another tpad cable and still nothing changed.
The trackpad connector looks perfectly clean on both sides of the board.

I also plugged in a new keyboard and that one didn't work either. I tried plugging in a usb with mac osx and hold option key but nothing happened. I also couldn't turn the machine off with the new keyboard.

Do you know what exactly those images mean? I can't find any information on it

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots to unknown screen
threads.message:
Okay so now I plugged in a new trackpad and cable together and this time when I booted it took me to the screen where it asks to choose the language for your computer so I think the trackpad may need replacing. When I do try to move my finger around on the trackpad the cursor does not move but I'm not sure if that is because the trackpad is not assembled into the machine.

I also plugged in another keyboard and I still cannot turn the machine off with the power button or use the option key to boot.

I checked voltages on the keyboard connector (J4813)
Pins 1/2/3 - 0v
Pin 4 - 3.42v
Pin 5 - 0v
Pin 6 - saw 1.3v and it goes down.

On the other side of the board I checked for continuity from Pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R4810</RESISTOR> to Probe #816 and there was no beep.
There is continuity though from Pin 5 of J4813 to the via above it. 

Update: I ran a wire from Pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R4810</RESISTOR> to Probe #816 and now the power button works to turn off the machine.
I'm still not able to boot my usb stick with the option key pressed even though I see Pin 2 of J4813 jump to 3.4v when I press the left option key.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots to unknown screen
threads.message: Okay so I plugged in the original trackpad cable and now it is working fine.
